person.persName: Perry Wherritt (Harrison County, Kentucky, tanner and county court clerk)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, tanner and county court clerk. Jessamine County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas Wherritt and Margaret King Wherritt. Married to Zerelda A. Morrison Wherritt in Harrison County, Kentucky, on February 24, 1831. Father of Sarah Wherritt, Ann Wherritt, Margaret Wherritt, David H. Wherritt, Mary Hannah Wherritt, Thomas Wherritt, and Ellen Wherritt. Student in Danville, Kentucky, in 1823. Tanner in Cynthiana from 1829 to 1840. Deputy marshal for the U.S. Census in Harrison County in 1840. Assignee in bankruptcy from 1842 to 1849. Postmaster at Cynthiana from September 1845 to September 5, 1849. Merchant in Cynthiana in 1844. Tanner in Harrison County in 1850. Elected clerk of the Harrison County Court in 1851. Clerk for the Harrison County Court in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons (including Sally and Mally) in Harrison County in 1860. Clerk for the Harrison County Court in 1861. Imprisoned at Camp Chase in Columbus, Ohio, from July 26, 1862, to October 31, 862. Signed a oath of allegiance to the U.S. government on October 31, 1862. Imprisoned at the Louisville Military Prison in Louisville, Kentucky, from August 1864 to September 3, 1864.
